content.description: This route is, for the most part, an Off-width. The cruxes are right at the start and another hard part at the finish. So wedge yourself in there and start the loathsome process of going up. Be careful not to wedge yourself too deep in there otherwise upward progress will be a whole lot harder. Enjoy!
content.protection:
2"-6". Two 6" pieces. A sling for a large horn that can be slung half way up the climb.

Two-bolt Anchor. 3rd class walk off.
content.location: The wedge is right before the dark corner so follow the trail past Frosted Flakes, head left when the trail splits and you'll see the dark corner, the wedge is just before it. Same walk off. You can also walk up, so this climb can be top-roped from the two bolt anchor.

content.description: Razor's Edge is a steep, thin and difficult lieback up a corner with a finger crack. The route is hard right off the start and keeps up for a long ways. the entire first half is sustained and solid 5.11 until you get to the upper section. The whole climb is along a steep finger crack in a leaning corner; halfway up, the corner turns sharply to be a strenuous undercling and then "mellows" out a bit at the top to 5.10 climbing. Bring tape and muscles!
content.protection: Most of the gear is small so bring plenty. doubles from small TCU's to 1", and singles of 2" and 3". two 60m ropes or one 70 would suffice.
content.location: Razor's Edge is the very last route along the entire wall. Follow the trail east until it ends at a steep, left-facing, thin corner. This is Razor's Edge.

content.description: Frosted Flakes is a series of flakes that lead upwards through fun 5.8 lie-backing and jamming, it's a relatively short route but fun. The route starts with an easy wide section up to the flakes, lie back until you'll transfer to the outward flake by stepping out and reaching left, continue up the corner to the top.
content.protection:
Fingers to 4" with doubles of hands and fists.

Two bolt anchor with a sport clip so just clip it and lower.
content.location: It's the first climb you come to in this area. The trail goes right by it, itÂ´s quite a ways east of the other areas. The route is several, left facing layered flakes that end at a visible bolted anchor at the top.

content.description: The route ascends a chimney that is in a deep corner, so this is a nice and cool route in the hot summer time. There are two cracks that run parallel up the entire climb and offer good placements for the length of the climb. Jam and chimney you way up, exit the chimney to the right and climb through some dirt and trees until you get to a flake you can built a belay anchor in. 3rd class walk off.
content.protection: Nuts to 2". Save some pieces for the anchor, .5-2"
content.location: Head past Frosted flakes, shortly after the trail will break off to the left. Head left, you'll see the route, it's the dark, wide corner. After topping out walk off to the climbers right. Third class.
